newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian sugar prices steady, consumer demand low.
newsitem.headline: Indian sugar prices steady, consumer demand low.

text.p: Indian sugar prices held steady on Tuesday on low consumer demand while limited arrivals kept the market in a narrow price band, traders said.
In the ready delivery sugar S-30 was steady at 1,280/1,320 rupees while M-30 was quiet at 1,305/1,362 rupees. Sugar mill delivery remained steady at 1,220/1,240 rupees.
Dealers said the free sale quota for January was low at 650,000 tonnes against 800,000 tonnes in December.
"Some of the major Hindu festivals are around the corner and I am expecting higher demand for sugar in the coming days," one dealer said.
